decks.notes: This deck focuses on filling the graveyard quickly and efficiently to fuel powerful dredge cards like Life from the Loam and Creeping Chill, while also taking advantage of cards that benefit from being in the graveyard such as Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast. By utilizing cards like Shriekhorn and Cathartic Reunion to draw and discard cards, the goal is to create a strong graveyard presence that can overwhelm the opponent with recurring threats and burn spells like Conflagrate. The deck aims to quickly set up its combo pieces and outvalue the opponent through efficient graveyard interactions.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and control elements to disrupt opponents while generating value with cards like Urza, Lord High Artificer and Emry, Lurker of the Loch. It includes a variety of mana-fixing tools such as Mishra's Bauble and Arcum's Astrolabe, as well as removal options like Engineered Explosives and Galvanic Blast. Cryptic Command provides versatile control options, while Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath offers card advantage and a threat on the battlefield. The deck aims to stall the game, outvalue opponents, and eventually win through Urza's powerful abilities.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Pillage and Magus of the Moon while ramping up its own mana with Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf. It utilizes powerful creatures like Glorybringer and Questing Beast to apply pressure on the opponent while also providing card advantage with Seasoned Pyromancer. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Bonecrusher Giant to deal with threats. Klothys, God of Destiny helps to gain life and disrupt graveyard strategies. Chandra, Torch of Defiance provides additional card advantage and removal.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's mana base with cards like Magus of the Moon and Pillage while ramping up your own mana with Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf. It also includes versatile removal in Lightning Bolt and a powerful finisher in Glorybringer. The deck also has a strong midrange game with cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Questing Beast. Klothys, God of Destiny provides recurring value and lifegain while Chandra, Torch of Defiance adds card advantage and flexibility. Overall, the deck aims to control the board, disrupt the opponent, and close out the game with powerful threats.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble an explosive combo using infect creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, backed up by pump spells such as Scale Up, Might of Old Krosa, and Mutagenic Growth. The goal is to deal 10 infect damage to the opponent as fast as possible, utilizing evasion through cards like Distortion Strike and protection with Vines of Vastwood and Blossoming Defense. By efficiently combining creatures with powerful pump spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in just a few turns.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This allows the player to cast powerful threats such as Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and other big creatures like Thragtusk and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes control elements like Sundering Titan and Oblivion Stone to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to establish board control and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and tempo of the game through a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. It aims to establish dominance with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria while utilizing cards like Ice-Fang Coatl and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath for card advantage and board presence. The deck also includes key interaction spells like Supreme Verdict and Cryptic Command to deal with threats efficiently. The mana base is optimized with Arcum's Astrolabe and a variety of fetch lands to ensure smooth gameplay and easy access to different colors of mana.

The main concept of this deck is to deal damage quickly and efficiently to the opponent through a combination of direct damage spells and aggressive creatures. By using cards like Lightning Bolt, Boros Charm, and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and punish the opponent for playing spells with cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel. The deck is designed to be fast-paced and relentless, aiming to close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and efficiently in order to assemble the combo of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle with Primeval Titan and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove. By using cards like Search for Tomorrow, Explore, and Sakura-Tribe Elder, the deck aims to get Valakut online as soon as possible to start dealing massive amounts of damage to the opponent. Additionally, the deck utilizes Karn, the Great Creator to fetch utility artifacts like Grafdigger's Cage or Ensnaring Bridge to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on ramping up quickly with Amulet of Vigor and various land untapping effects to cast Primeval Titan as soon as possible. By utilizing lands like Castle Garenbrig and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove, the deck can generate a large amount of mana to search for Field of the Dead and overwhelm the opponent with zombie tokens. Karn, the Great Creator provides access to sideboard hate cards and utility artifacts, while Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle acts as additional win condition. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces efficiently to overpower the opponent.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It utilizes control elements such as Oblivion Stone and Karn Liberated to disrupt opponents and maintain board control. The deck has a strong late-game win condition with powerful creatures like Wurmcoil Engine and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The inclusion of cards like Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying helps the deck to consistently find its key lands and threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its powerful late-game threats while controlling the battlefield.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible using low-cost burn spells and efficient creatures. By utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt, Boros Charm, and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and finish the game before they have a chance to stabilize. The key strategy is to maintain a fast pace of play and keep the opponent on the back foot, utilizing efficient removal spells and hasty creatures to secure victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and mana ramp to control the game, with strong interaction and card advantage provided by cards like Urza, Lord High Artificer and Cryptic Command. Mystic Sanctuary is used to recur key spells, while Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provides additional card advantage and life gain. Emry, Lurker of the Loch can help recur artifacts from the graveyard, while Engineered Explosives and Galvanic Blast provide removal options. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating value and controlling the game.

The primary strategy of this Bant Control deck is to utilize a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage engines to control the board and outvalue the opponent. The deck aims to stall the game with cards like Path to Exile and Supreme Verdict, while generating card advantage with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck also has access to powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler to further control the game and dictate the tempo.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage while ramping up to play powerful threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. It also utilizes snow lands to support cards like Ice-Fang Coatl and Arcum's Astrolabe for additional value. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, draw out the game, and eventually overwhelm them with big, game-ending plays.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently assemble the combo of Ad Nauseam and Angel's Grace, allowing the player to draw their entire deck and win the game with Thassa's Oracle. The deck includes cards like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism to ramp up mana quickly, as well as cards like Spoils of the Vault to search for key combo pieces. Phyrexian Unlife can help to stall the game until the combo is assembled. The deck is designed to be fast and consistent in executing its win condition.
